    ArrayList<User>
    DataController.loadUsers()
    The loadUsers method reads the database of users and returns an ArrayList of User objects which represents the full database
    Methods in controller with parameters of type User
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    AppController.onUserLoggedIn(User user)
    The onUserLoggedIn method creates a new PreGameController instance, and takes in a User instance brought over from the login attempt
    Pre-game screen inputs and interactions are then listened for
    If the user chooses to play pong, then the runPong method is called, passing in the user's username
    private void
    AppController.onUserRegistered(User user)
    The onUserRegistered method creates a new PreGameController instance, and takes in a User instance brought over from the register attempt
    Pre-game screen inputs and interactions are then listened for
    If the user chooses to play pong, then the runPong method is called, passing in the user's username
    void
    DataController.saveUser(User updatedUser, ArrayList<User> users)
    The saveUser method takes in the users ArrayList and an updatedUser, which may or may not represent an existing user, as it may represent a new user
    If the user exists, then their new data will represent an updated win count (via updatedUser)
    If the user exists, then their old data will be removed from users, and their new data (via updatedUser) will be added to the users ArrayList
    If the user is new, then their data will be added to the users ArrayList
    From the users ArrayList, the data will be written to the users database for persistent storage
    Method parameters in controller with type arguments of type User
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    DataController.saveUser(User updatedUser, ArrayList<User> users)
    The saveUser method takes in the users ArrayList and an updatedUser, which may or may not represent an existing user, as it may represent a new user
    If the user exists, then their new data will represent an updated win count (via updatedUser)
    If the user exists, then their old data will be removed from users, and their new data (via updatedUser) will be added to the users ArrayList
    If the user is new, then their data will be added to the users ArrayList
    From the users ArrayList, the data will be written to the users database for persistent storage
